Emergency Notifications
=======================

[I Want To...](https://www.cityoftroy.us/10842/i-want-to) » [Subscribe to...](https://www.cityoftroy.us/35531/subscribe-to) »

* [Subscribe to...](https://www.cityoftroy.us/35531/subscribe-to)

* [City of Troy Notifications](https://www.cityoftroy.us/subscribe)
* [Emergency Notifications](https://www.cityoftroy.us/22075/emergency-notifications)

NEW EMERGENCY NOTIFICATION SYSTEM

 The City of Troy, in partnership with the Central Texas Council of Governments (with all of Bell County municipalities)  has a new reverse 9-1-1 notification system, Code Red.  Reverse 9-1-1 is used when Police, Fire, and Government officials need to notify the public of emergency situations and any actions they should take to protect lives and property.  Many people will not receive these important notices because of the decline of home/land-line phones, so residents and business owners are encouraged to self-register their contact information.

**Telephone number listed with 911 will be automatically be migrated to this system.  If you wish to add cell phones or email addresses, you must sign up via the link or telephone number provided below.**

**It is important to note that when you sign up for this free service, you may also elect to receive severe weather notifications.**

Please follow the links below to self-register cell phones and email addresses.  This will also allow the confirmation of a home/business location on a map.  This reverse 9-1-1 is also being utilized by cities within Bell County and surrounding counties (Coryell, Milam, Mills, Lampasas,  Hamilton, and San Saba).  Registration of cell phones and emails is voluntary.

Self-Registration link:

[Register for CodeRed](https://public.coderedweb.com/CNE/BFF2144C1EE5 "Register for CodeRed")

Or register by phone - 866-939-0911
